metadata.title: CVE-2024-38586 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: r8169:Fix possible ring buffer corruption on fragmented Tx packets. An issue wasfound on the RTL8125b when transmitting small fragmented packets, wherebyinvalid entries were inserted into the transmit ring buffer, subsequentlyleading to calls to dma_unmap_single() with a null address. This was causedby rtl8169_start_xmit() not noticing changes to nr_frags which may occurwhen small packets are padded (to work around hardware quirks) inrtl8169_tso_csum_v2(). To fix this, postpone inspecting nr_frags untilafter any padding has been applied.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38586` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
